Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The scenario implies all activities can appear in any order? Usually supply chain may have linear order: SS -> OP -> RC -> QI -> CA -> PT -> PK -> WS -> DT -> AS. That is typical linear.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Provide realistic numbers: e.g., Supplier selection maybe a few days: average 3 days (259200 sec) with std 1 day (86400). Order Placement maybe 0.5 days (43200 sec) with std 0.2 days (17280).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Define baseline times for each activity relative to previous: SS: ~3 days (259200 sec) OP: ~0.5 days after SS (43200 sec) RC: ~1 day after OP (86400 sec) QI: ~2 days after RC (172800 sec) CA: ~5 days after QI (432000 sec)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: cum_SS = 0 (time of SS) cum_OP = d_SS_OP = 259200 cum_RC = cum_OP + d_OP_RC = 259200+43200=302400 cum_QI = cum_RC + d_RC_QI = 302400+86400=388800

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Define base stdev: stdev_SS_OP: 1 day = 86400 sec. stdev_OP_RC: 0.2 days = 17280 sec. stdev_RC_QI: 0.5 days = 43200 sec.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: cum_var[0] = var0 = 7.46496e9 cum_var[1] = var0+var1 = 7.7635584e9 cum_var[2] = +var2 = 9.6297984e9 pair variance for i<j: cum_var[j-1] - cum_var[i-1]

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Use integer approximations: stdev values approximated to nearest integer second. dictionary will be something like { ('SS','OP'): (259200, 86400), ('SS','RC'): (302400, 88065),
